issue.title: [C++] Review experimental / unstable APIs
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-5244](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5244). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Some C++ APIs are currently marked experimental (or perhaps unstable). We should review them and perhaps promote some of them to stable, or perhaps remove those that have proven unhelpful.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5244?focusedCommentId=16830426) by Neal Richardson (npr):*
Are these indications primarily in code comments or in the docs? I can help compile a list of them, if that would be useful.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5244?focusedCommentId=16830705) by Neal Richardson (npr):*
I did some searching in GitHub and identified the patches that introduced code that is flagged as "experimental", both in comments and in docs. Here's a summary: <https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1qhjxwKrQmvY5H69VV1kfMZeqIEoZP3dCVEW8fmyBajQ/edit#gid=0>

I added a column for "still experimental?", which should be filled out by those who know the corresponding APIs best.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5244?focusedCommentId=17209601) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
The only thing that stands out is the Scalar API. I think we can remove the experimental label from it. `[~bkietz]` What do you think?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5244?focusedCommentId=17396182) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
Issue resolved by pull request 10886
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/10886>
